The steering force is the desired velocity
minus its current velocity.

It actually makes total sense, right?
If I'm going in this direction, but I
want to be going in this direction,
the way I should steer is the difference

It's like almost an error.
If I'm moving in exactly the same direction

I don't need to change my velocity.

Like, this particle is attracted to this attractor?
Well, it's very similar, but it's quite different.
In the gravitational attraction example,

It didn't understand, if I'm going in this direction,
